_header: Of their nature they greatly them delight
Note: Stanza 1 = stanza 16 of 1525; stanza 2 has a ‘Blind eat fly’ refrain, cf. 3184.
_description: A balade on hypocritical women — four stanzas rhyme royal

CamTCC599.First Lines:
[O]f theyre nature they gretly theym delyteWith holy face feynyd
                    for the nonesIn sayntwary theyre frendys to vysyteMore for reliques
                    than for seyntes bones…
CamTCC599.Last Lines:
…Hym saue and kepe both nyght and dayWretyn in the lusty
                    season of may
